text: In Greek mythology, the name Molus (/ˈmoʊləs/; Ancient Greek: Μῶλος Molos means "toil and moil") was a warrior from Argos who came with king Sthenelus to join the Trojan War. He was killed by Agenor, son of the Trojan elder, AntenorQuintus Smyrnaeus. The Fall of Troy 6.624, Translated by Way. A. S. Loeb Classical Library Volume 19. London: William Heinemann, 1913. == Mythology == === Quintus Smyrnaeus' Account === > "Agenor smote Molus the princely, -- with king Sthenelus he came from Argos, > -- hurled from far behind a dart new-whetted, as he fled from fight, > piercing his right leg, and the eager shaft cut sheer through the broad > sinew, shattering the bones with anguished pain: and so his doom met him, to > die a death of agony." == References == Category:Characters in Greek mythology
title: Molus (Argive soldier)
